item.title: No black bin installed, 23rd June
item.description:
The issue on Streetcare hasbeen closed as I have been told to report it on here, so please do not mark this as a duplicate. There has been no black bin installed since the bus stop opened and litter is continuosly left on the left or bags hung on the fencing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shackleton Way, Gallions Reach, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds growing extensively over the pavement in Carver Road., 23rd June
item.description:
Weeds growing through the cracks in the paving stones, covering one side of the pavement at the bottom end of Carver Road, It looks a terrible mess on an otherwise very weed free and tidy road. Also mixed with dead leaves. Don't think it has been cleaned for a very long time .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carver Road, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over filled bin, dog mess bags, litter blown everywhere down the alley between the bridge and to Millennium Green, 23rd June
item.description:
Over filled bin- has not been emptied in weeks. Foxes or/and wind has blown dog mess bags (many ripped open), and litter all over the alley. Has been like this for at least a couple of weeks. Dog mess everywhere. Gross.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sydenham Park, Forest Hill, London

item.title: Urgent Concern Regarding Dangerous Overhanging Tree Limbs, 23rd June
item.description:
I am writing to raise a serious ongoing concern about overhanging tree limbs from a neighbour’s garden, which I believe pose a significant threat to the safety of my family. In the past, large limbs have fallen into my garden, and if one were to fall on a member of my family, the consequences could be catastrophic. This issue has been reported to Bromley Council multiple times over the past four years, yet I have not received a satisfactory response or resolution. Despite repeated attempts to communicate with my neighbour—both in person and in writing—he has refused to co-operate. My family and I are extremely dissatisfied with the level of lazy and dismissive responses received from Bromley Council to date, particularly given that no meaningful investigation into the issue appears to have taken place. I have now been advised that, should I once again receive an inadequate response, I should contact the News Shopper to share my story and highlight the Council’s ongoing failure to act. I would also like to draw your attention to the following statement from your own policy: “Once contacted the householder usually has 28 days to cut back the vegetation. If it is not cut back within this time, we will issue an Enforcement Notice. If this is not complied with, we will arrange for our contractor to undertake the work, the cost of which will be charged back to the householder.” Given the potential danger to life and the ongoing nature of this problem, I urge you to take immediate action in line with your stated policy. Please confirm receipt of this message and advise me on the next steps.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Steyning Grove, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Openreach noise, obstructive works, 23rd June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Sussex Mews West, Paddington, London
